text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with how to cook a turkey the
holidays are coming up Thanksgiving
Christmas and a lot of people are afraid
to cook turkey they're chicken so here's
how I do it this is the very simple
basic method I'm going to make a
seasoned salt with some black pepper
some salt and some poultry seasoning
just a very basic seasoning mix the
second part of the seasoning is this
mirepoix this is carrots celery and
onions cut up and then I do a flavored
butter with some rosemary and sage and a
little bit of garlic you're going to
take the package that comes into Turkey
you're going to take out the neck the
heart and the gizzard but not the liver
with one bay leaf in about 6 cups of
water and you can put that on to simmer
and that's going to cook for a couple
hours that's going to make a quick
turkey stock that we use in part two all
right this is part 1 all right now to
prep the turkey by the way this is a 12
pound turkey
I hate burnt wing tips there's nothing
uglier than a burnt wing tip so we're
going to fold that underneath like that
alright and that's going to give it a
nice stable base and it's going to look
a lot prettier now we're going to pull
the turkey up on its head and you're
going to liberally season the inside all
right all over you need a good amount
we're also going to put a handful of the
mirepoix not a lot just a handful and
then we're going to stuff some rosemary
and sage in there also and it's going to
make for a very aromatic turkey kind of
flavored from the inside then we're
going to tie the legs together with some
string you can use unflavored floss
alright don't use a minty fresh kind but
to any kind of floss will work alright
so that's the inside done
now for the outside I'm going to go and
I'm going to loosen the skin on the top
of the breast now you can start it with
your fingers what I like to do is take a
thin rubber spatula it has to be
something that's dull okay because it a
metal object will might tear through the
skin the skin is very tough the sharp
edge will poke through which is not what
you want so I'm going to take a spatula
like that and just kind of open up that
skin it's actually not that hard I'm
going to put two big spoons of my
flavored butter my herb butter
underneath the skin I'm just going to
rub it down until it kind of spreads out
evenly and that's going to really keep
the breast moist and flavor from the
inside okay then I'm going to take the
rest of the butter and I'm going to
spread it all over the outside and the
sides don't just do it on the top and
that's really going to keep the outside
moist and flavorful we're going to salt
and pepper with our spice mix there the
outside liberally all right I'm going to
dump the rest of the mirepoix
in a pan I'm going to put the turkey on
top and I'm going to pour in a little
bit of water to make for a moist cooking
environment and also it gives me some
great juices later to add to my gravy
I'm going to put some foil over the
turkey breasts very important for the
first half of the cooking approximately
so whether that doesn't get overcooked
or too dark on top then I'm going to
pull that off and it's going to get nice
and brown later you'll see that in part
two all right we're going to roast that
at 325 a nice slow oven one of the
secrets slow oven we're gonna do that
about 18 minutes per pound you got this
just an approximate time you got to
check with a thermometer 165 is what you
want okay so you can do the math so you
have an idea but towards the end you're
going to test it in the thickest part of
the thigh and that's how you know it's
done
so that's part one how to prep the
turkey get it in the oven and in part
two
we're going to pull it out let it rest
and make the gravy okay so anyway I hope
you enjoyed that all the ingredients for
that stuff's on the site and as always
angel
